CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 4, 1946, pg. 4, reads: "Offensive Role in School Play - Members of the Negro student body of Penn High School, Penn Township, resented the characterization of an ignorant, superstitious washwoman in a play, 'Whispering Walls,' staged Tuesday morning in the school auditorium.  The character was portrayed by a white student with a blackened face, who spoke with a broad dialect. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Actors, including young woman in blackface, on stage for production of "Whispering Walls," by Penn High School students
